docs.title: PinPod & BoM Integrated Architecture
docs.text: This document serves as a key technical architecture guide, synthesizing concepts from the BoM and PinPod into a cohesive ecosystem.

docs.title: Executive Summary
docs.text:
The PinPod ecosystem is designed as a Hybrid Web 2.5 platform, combining the speed and accessibility of Web 2.0 applications with the security and decentralization of Web 3.0 technologies.

  • PinPod is the user-facing application layer, built using Flutter for mobile (Android/iOS) and web platforms. It is the "face" of the ecosystem.

  • The BoM (Book of Memes) is the behind-the-scenes logic layer, serving as the "brain" or "intelligent agent" built using Python. The BoM handles complex data processing, core business logic, and interaction with the decentralized network.

  • Both are connected by Supabase as a centralized data layer and IPFS as a decentralized storage layer.

docs.title: Core Architecture (Hybrid Web 2.5)
docs.text:
This hybrid approach is taken to maximize the benefits of both worlds:

  1. Speed (Web 2.0): A responsive user experience is a priority. Therefore, all key data requiring fast queries (user profiles, service lists, transactions) is indexed and stored in a PostgreSQL database managed by Supabase.
  2. Ownership & Immutability (Web 3.0): Core user-generated content ("Beans"), such as files, images, or important documents, is stored in IPFS (InterPlanetary File System). This ensures that the data is immutable and ownership is clear, with only the hash (CID) of the content stored in Supabase.

docs.title: Component Details
docs.text: Component Role Technology Hosting PinPod App Application Layer (Frontend) Flutter User Device (Mobile/Web) BoM Agent Logic Layer (Backend) Python, Docker Google Cloud Run Supabase Data Layer (Database) PostgreSQL Supabase Cloud IPFS Storage Layer (File Storage) IPFS Protocol Pinata (or node itself) Web Scanner Public Explorer Next.js/React Vercel

docs.title: 1. PinPod (The Application Layer)
docs.text:
This Flutter app is where all user interactions occur. Follows the "Tree of Life" architecture:

  • Root: Connects to Supabase for basic data and Firebase for authentication.
  • Trunk: Manages the application state (using Riverpod/Bloc) and user flow logic.
  • Crown (UI): Displays different interfaces for "Seekers" (PINs) and "Providers" (PODs), as well as a dashboard, interactive map, and service creation form ("Bean").

docs.title: 2. BoM (The Logic Layer)
docs.text:
This Python agent is a data processing engine. It has no direct user interface but provides services through an API:

  • Encryption & Hashing: Secures data and ensures integrity using the BLAKE3 algorithm.
  • Semantic Processing: Runs the "DNA" and "Lexicon" algorithms to categorize and correlate data.
  • IPFS Interaction: Manages file uploads to IPFS (via services like Pinata) and returns the CID for storage in Supabase.
  • AI Services: Integrates with LLM models (such as OpenAI) to provide intelligent features within the PinPod app (e.g., generating product descriptions).

docs.title: 3. Supabase (The Data Layer)
docs.text:
Acts as a "Map" or "Index" for the entire ecosystem. It is a single source of truth for structured and frequently accessed data.

  • Main Tables: users, pods (stores), beans (services/products), transactions.
  • BoM Integration: Stores metadata and IPFS hashes (CIDs) generated by the BoM.
  • Security: Uses Row-Level Security (RLS) to ensure users can only access their own data.

docs.title: 4. IPFS (The Storage Layer)
docs.text:
Serves as an immutable "repository" for digital content.

  • What's Stored: An image, video, PDF, or other digital asset file that is part of a "Bean".
  • Flow: The PinPod app sends the file to the BoM Agent, which then "pins" the file to IPFS via Pinata and returns the CID.

docs.title: Interaction Model & Data Flow
docs.text:
The main data flow is as follows:

Scenario: User (Provider) Creates a New Service ("Bean")

  1. PinPod App: The user fills out a form in the app (description, price) and uploads an image.
  2. API Call to BoM: The app sends the form data and image file to the BoM Agent via an API call (HTTP POST).
  3. BoM Agent - Internal Process: a. Receives data. b. Uploads the image file to IPFS and obtains the image_cid. c. Create a hash of all "Bean" data using BLAKE3 for integrity_hash. d. (Optional) Call LLM to suggest a better description.
  4. BoM Agent -> Supabase: The agent stores all metadata, image_cid, and integrity_hash into the beans table in Supabase.
  5. Supabase -> PinPod App: The PinPod app, which listens for changes to the beans table (via Supabase Realtime), automatically exposes the new service in the user interface.

docs.title: Implementation & Deployment Strategy
docs.text:
1. Frontend (Web Scanner): Build the scane.ioi.coin application using Next.js and deploy it on Vercel. This will be a public "storefront" that reads data directly from Supabase.
  2. Backend (BoM Agent): Develop the BoM logic as a Python application (e.g., using FastAPI), package it in Docker, and deploy it on Google Cloud Run. This ensures scalability and cost-efficiency (pay-as-you-go).
  3. Database & Auth: Use Supabase for database management, authentication, and RLS. This significantly simplifies backend development.
  4. Main Application (PinPod): Develop a Flutter application, connect it to Supabase for real-time data and to the BoM Agent API for heavy-duty tasks.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Setup Supabase: Create a new project in Supabase, define the table schemas (users, pods, beans), and set the RLS policy.
  2. Initial Development of the BoM Agent: Create the first API endpoint in Python (for example, to upload files to IPFS) and deploy it to Google Cloud Run for testing.
  3. Initial Development of the PinPod App: Connect the Flutter app to Supabase authentication and create a feature to read and display data from the beans table.
  4. End-to-End Integration: Implement the complete "Bean" creation flow as described above to validate the architecture.

docs.title: PinPod: Future Life Made Easier by Connecting the Global Community Digitally
docs.text: PinPod.io exists to meet the need for a fair, decentralized, and empowering global service platform for every individual. It's not just a marketplace; it's an ecosystem designed to bring your unique potential, skills, or assets—what we call "Beans"—to life in the global, digital age.

docs.title: PinPod Vision: Decentralized Global Business Design
docs.text: PinPod's core vision is to create a global public service infrastructure accessible to everyone, from the personal to the industrial level. The platform is ready to serve the global public community, creating a decentralized global business model, making it accessible to all.

docs.title: 1. Individual Empowerment (Producer-Consumer)
docs.text: PinPod operates on the philosophy of "Growing Together from Seed" and a dual role model of Producer-Consumer (called Podlings). Each user can seamlessly switch between these roles: * Pod (Producer): Service providers who manage their digital storefronts and offer "Beans" (units of service, products, or specific skills) from various business models created from the Bean. * Pin (Consumer/Carer): Service seekers who "water the seeds" (Beans) with requests, functionally acting as their own Need Curators (saving, tagging, and managing services of interest).

docs.title: 2. Global Public Services for All
docs.text: PinPod was intentionally developed as a global public service platform. With PinPod, services are no longer centralized in large entities, but instead distributed to individuals and small businesses around the world. * Hyper-Local Reach: Powered by Hyper-Local Technology (integrated with Google Maps API), Pins can quickly find the nearest and most relevant services. * Foundation of Trust: The community is supported by a robust security and transparency system: * Escrow System: Guarantees transaction security, ensuring funds are only released after Pins confirm satisfaction with the completed service. * KYC Verification (Gold Icon): Builds a Foundation of Trust for Pods (service providers). * Review System (Sunlight/Trust): Ensures transparent and community-driven service quality.

docs.title: 3. Simplifying Future Life
docs.text:
Through a simple structure (Bean and Nut) and advanced technology, PinPod is enabling a simpler future life: * BoM Agent (Artificial Intelligence): A contextual AI assistant helps Pods improve their business (Purple mode) and Pins find the best services (Green mode), reducing friction in transactions and doing business. * Modern Technology Stack: Built on Flutter and Supabase, the platform ensures a seamless, mobile-first experience.

Conclusion: PinPod.io is a decentralized global community hub. It's a platform that transforms the way we exchange value, making every transaction a seed of growth, and every user an architect of a simpler and more empowering economic future for the entire global public community.

docs.title: Global Decentralized Service Platform
docs.text: PinPod.io is a global platform designed to empower individuals and small businesses by facilitating the exchange of services and skills. The platform utilizes a unique dual-role model ("Producer-Consumer") and a detailed service structure ("Beans") secured by an escrow system.

docs.title: 1. Core Philosophy and Structure
docs.text: PinPod is a global marketplace and service platform with a dual-role structure (Producer-Consumer). The platform is built on the philosophy of Growing Together from Seed, which aims to empower individuals by providing an ecosystem that supports the growth of their potential, skills, or unique assets, referred to as "Bean."

docs.title: Core Concepts and Terminology:
docs.text:
• Podlings: All members of a community, acting as Producer-Consumer.
  • Pins: Users who act as service seekers or buyers.
  • Pods: Service providers, who manage their digital stores ("personal greenhouses").
  • Beans: A specific unit of service, product, or skill offered by a Pod.
  • Nuts: Optional add-ons or enhancements that accompany a Bean.

docs.title: 2. Pin Roles (Customer/Caregiver) - In-Depth Details
docs.text: Pin is a core component and key terminology within the PinPod platform, defined by its primary role as a service finder and its crucial function within the platform's unique philosophical framework.

docs.title: Dual Role Definition and Context
docs.text:
• Primary Role (Customer): A Pin is defined as a Service Seeker (Customer). A Pin is a user who searches for or orders a service or Bean.
  • Dual Use (Action): The term "Pin" also functions as a verb, referring to the act of 'save/ordering' (saving, ordering, or bookmarking) a service (Bean) or Pod.
  • Producer-Consumer Model: PinPod operates on a "Producer-Consumer" model, where users seamlessly switch between consuming services (acting as Pins) and producing services (acting as Pods). Every user has the ability to be a Pin.

docs.title: Pins 📌
docs.text:
In the context of the platform's core philosophy, Pins are crucial (product and service finders) to activate the economic ecosystem.

  • Driving Growth (Philosophical): Pins provide the demand energy that "waters the seeds" (the services offered by the Pod), enabling the growth of the Pod's business and reputation. Pins are given the philosophical role of The Nurturer who drives the ecosystem.
  • Need (Empty Land - Philosophical): Pins' need for a service is analogous to "Empty Land" needing "seeds" (Beans). Pins experience "Growth" as their problems are solved.

docs.title: Functional Role of Pin (Needs Recording System)
docs.text:
'Pin📌' powers the ecosystem. Functionally, Pin acts as a personalization and archiving system for users.

Simply put, when you act as a Pin, you have the ability to:

PinPod Concept User System Analogy Purpose Pin (Verb) Save/Bookmark/Like To save an interesting Bean (service) or Pod (provider), such as adding an item to a Wish List, Favorites, or pressing the Like button. Pinned Notes Personal Gallery/Watchlist Makes it easier for users to have a digital record of the services they are interested in, so they don't have to search again. Simplify Shopping Quick Shopping Cart Pinned services can be ordered or accessed again quickly (simplifying the shopping process). Simplify Link Connections Contact/Follow List Marking specific Pods that you trust and want to continue following strengthens the relationship between you and the service provider.

The bottom line: Pins are not just customers, but also their own Need Curators. The act of "Pinning" is a core mechanism that allows users to: * Archive relevant services. * Note quality providers (Pods). * Facilitate future bookings. * Save links to services they consider "seeds" they want to "water" later.

docs.title: Functional Interactions and Security
docs.text: As a customer, Pin's interactions with the platform are highly focused on discovery, trust, and secure transactions. * Service Discovery: Pin uses a Hyper-Local Focused Search System, which is based on location (integrated with Google Maps), category, and filters (price, rating, distance) to find the most relevant nearby services. * Transaction Security: Pin relies on an Escrow System to ensure security. This system securely holds funds, guaranteeing they will only be released to the Pod after the Pin confirms satisfaction with the completed service. Pins have the ability to refuse to release payments if issues arise. * Building Trust: Pin uses a transparent Rating/Review system (referred to as Sunlight/Trust) to assess the quality of service providers. Pins are responsible for providing these ratings and reviews after the service is completed.

docs.title: 3. Platform Key Features
docs.text: In addition to the role of Pins, the platform has the following key features: * Transaction Security: Uses the Escrow System (previously described) to ensure trust and security. * Artificial Intelligence (BoM Agent): A contextual AI assistant whose functions and colors change based on the user's mode. * Green: General search guidance. * Purple: Business analysis and performance tips for Pods. * Blue: Assistance in writing compelling Bean descriptions and pricing suggestions. * Hyper-Local Technology: Uses the Google Maps API to facilitate the search for services based on nearby locations. * Foundation of Trust: Supported by Identity Verification (KYC) for Pods (marked with a Gold icon) and a gamified review system (PinPoints).

docs.title: 4. Technology Architecture and Core Application Flow
Technology Stack:
docs.text:
• Frontend: Developed using Flutter (for a seamless, mobile-first experience).
  • Backend: Uses Supabase (PostgreSQL) as the core database and Firebase.

docs.title: Core App Flow:
docs.text:
The app has core pages such as home.dart (public dashboard), pin.dart (discoverer dashboard), pod.dart (provider control center), and bean.dart (service editor). Users can easily switch between Pin Mode and Pod Mode.

General Conclusion: The PinPod project is an ambitious effort to create a decentralized economic ecosystem focused on individual empowerment, supported by modern technology and a foundation of trust (collateral, AI smart contract time stamp).

docs.title: Target Users of the PinPod.io Platform
docs.text: This document explains in detail who the main target users of the PinPod.io platform are, based on the philosophy, architecture, and goals of the ecosystem being built.

docs.title: Executive Summary
docs.text:
Fundamentally, PinPod.io is designed for everyone. The platform doesn't target a narrow demographic niche, but rather builds an inclusive digital ecosystem where every individual can participate as both a producer (provider) and a consumer (seeker).

Its primary audience is individuals and groups who want to engage in the skills-based economy (skill-based economy), services, and products on a scale from hyperlocal to global.

docs.title: Filosofi Inti: "Growing Together from Seeds"
docs.text:
To understand its users, it is important to understand PinPod's basic philosophy: "Growing Together from Seed".

  • Life Seeds: The platform recognizes that every individual possesses a "seed" of potential. This seed can be a skill, an asset, or free time.
  • Fertile Ground: PinPod.io serves as the "ground" or ecosystem that provides the tools, security, and market access for these "seeds" to grow into tangible results (economic value).

Thus, the most basic target user is anyone who has potential (Seed) to offer, or anyone who needs the results of someone else's potential.

docs.title: Key Concept: Dual Roles in the "Podlings" Community
docs.text:
All users within the PinPod ecosystem are referred to as "Podlings." The platform's main feature is that each Podling can easily switch between two main roles:

  1. Pin (Seeker/Buyer)
  2. Pod (Provider/Seller)

This flexibility defines a very broad and dynamic audience. Below are details of both user profiles.

docs.title: User Profile #1: "Pin" - The Seeker
docs.text: A “Pin” is a role that users take on when they act as a seeker or buyer of a service/product.

docs.title: Who Are They?
docs.text:
• General Individuals: People who need help with everyday tasks, such as home repairs, private tutoring for children, photography services for family events, or finding home-cooked food nearby.
  • Businesses & Startups: Includes Micro, Small, and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs), startups, and businesses of all sizes that need professional services without having to hire full-time employees. Examples include logo design, social media management, legal consultation, or software prototype development.
  • Communities or Organizations: Groups seeking talent for a project, such as musicians for a band, artists for an exhibition, or volunteers for a social cause.
  • Tourists or Visitors: People in a new location and looking to find authentic local services, such as tour guides, traditional cooking classes, or vehicle rentals.

docs.title: Their Primary Motivations:
docs.text:
• Need: Seeking efficient and fast solutions to specific problems or needs.
  • Discovery: Finding unique and authentic service providers not available in the conventional market.
  • Trust and Security: Conducting transactions with a sense of security thanks to the escrow and verification system.
  • Efficiency: Saving time and effort in finding and validating service providers.

docs.title: User Profile #2: "Pod" - The Provider
docs.text: “Pods” are the roles users take on when they manage a “digital storefront” to offer their potential.

docs.title: Who Are They?
docs.text:
• Professionals & Freelancers: Graphic designers, writers, developers, accountants, consultants, and other professionals who want to sell their skills on a per-project basis.
  • Local Service Providers: AC repairmen, mechanics, tutors, tailors, home cooks, or any service provider who serves their local community.
  • Creators & Artists: Musicians, painters, photographers, craftspeople who want to sell their products or work and offer services (e.g., performing at events).
  • Asset Owners: People who own assets they can rent out, such as equipment (cameras, drills), space (mini studios, meeting rooms), or even vehicles.
  • Individuals with Free Time: Students or anyone who wants to monetize their free time by offering simple services, such as shopping, pet care, or temporary personal assistantships.

docs.title: Their Primary Motivations:
docs.text:
• Monetization: Turning skills, hobbies, and assets into a source of income.
  • Market Access: Reaching a wider audience and customers beyond their network.
  • Flexibility: Working on their own time and in their own way.
  • Building a Reputation: Collecting reviews and building a digital portfolio to increase their credibility and marketability.

docs.title: Conclusion: Open Ecosystem for Shared Growth
docs.text:
The PinPod.io platform targets the wider community by empowering them to become active economic actors. It is a platform for:

  • Starting entrepreneurs who want to test their business ideas with low risk.
  • Established professionals looking for a side hustle or new clients.
  • Anyone who wants to find trusted help for any need, while supporting the local economy and the people around them.

By eliminating the barriers between providers and seekers, PinPod creates a fluid marketplace where everyone can find value and grow their potential.

docs.title: PinPod Security Revolution: Zero Knowledge, Total Trust
docs.text:
In today's digital age, online platforms demand your trust, but what do they offer in return? Their standard model is to collect, store, and control your data. Your privacy depends on their policies, and your security depends on how strong their defenses are against hacker attacks.

PinPod.io was built on a different question: "What if a platform didn't need to ask for your trust, because its trust was already mathematically embedded in its code?"

Welcome to PinPod, an ecosystem where security isn't just a feature, it's the foundation. We don't just secure your data; we build an architecture where we can't even access your sensitive data. This is our security revolution, a four-layered defense like never before.

docs.title: PinPod's Four-Layered Fortress: The Future of Trust Architecture
docs.text: Imagine a digital fortress. Most platforms only have one wall. PinPod has four.

docs.title: Layer 1: Outer Wall – Secure Transactions for a Fair Market
docs.text:
This layer is your frontline defense, ensuring every interaction within the marketplace is fair, transparent, and secure.

  • Private Transaction Guard (Escrow System): Every payment you make is automatically held by the system. The funds will only be released after you confirm that you are satisfied. This is your anti-fraud guarantee.
  • Credibility Badge (KYC Verification): Interact with confidence. Sellers who have verified their identity will have a trust badge, so you know they are a real and accountable entity.
  • Community-Driven Integrity (Reputation System): The power lies in the hands of the community. Every review builds or destroys reputation, creating a self-policing system that naturally filters out bad actors and rewards honesty.

docs.title: Layer 2: Inner Walls – Reinforced Smart Architecture
docs.text:
This layer is the internal structure of our fortress—intelligent, robust, and designed to deny unauthorized access from the start.

  • Impregnable Gateway (Managed Authentication): We delegate the authentication process to Firebase Auth & App Check, the industry gold standard. Only fully verified users and devices are allowed in—no exceptions.
  • Central Watchtower (API Gateway): All data traffic—without exception—must pass through a single central inspection gateway powered by Supabase. This allows us to enforce strict security policies and monitor every request that enters the heart of the system.
  • App Sandbox: Every process within an application runs within an isolated environment. If an anomaly occurs in one area, the impact is contained and cannot spread to other parts of the system.

docs.title: Layer 3: Property Space – The Eternal Truth Ledger
docs.text:
At the heart of our fortress, we don't just store records—we engrave them in digital stone. This layer ensures that your data history cannot be altered or manipulated.

  • Immutable Digital DNA (Immutable Ledger): Inspired by blockchain technology, every transaction is cryptographically linked to the previous one. Changing a single "letter" in this DNA breaks the entire chain, making data manipulation mathematically impossible. Your history is secure forever.
  • Automated Digital Notarization (Integrity Check): When you link to external content, the system automatically creates a digital "fingerprint" of that content. If that content is altered by an outside party, the platform will know.

docs.title: Layer 4: The Holy of Holies – Absolute Privacy with Zero-Knowledge Architecture
docs.text:
This is the real revolution. This layer is at the heart of our philosophy, designed to protect your privacy, even from ourselves.

Our Greatest Feature Is What We Can't Do: We Can't See Your Data.

  • Zero-Storage Backend: This is a paradigm shift. PinPod servers fundamentally never store your files or sensitive data. We only store pointers to the location of that data, while the actual data remains under your control—on your device or on a decentralized network (IPFS).
  • Unbreakable Seal (Client-Side Encryption): Your private conversations and negotiations are encrypted directly on your device before being sent. The data traverses the internet as scrambled text that is unreadable by anyone, including the PinPod team.
  • Zero-Knowledge Proof of Interaction: We can cryptographically prove that a transaction or interaction has occurred—for dispute resolution purposes—without ever knowing the content of that interaction. Your privacy is guaranteed by mathematics, not by political promises.
  • Financial Confidentiality (OTC Transactions): The pricing details of your private transactions are also kept private, ensuring your business remains your own.

docs.title: Why This Changes Everything: PinPod vs. Other Platforms
docs.text: Features Traditional Platform PinPod.io Data Storage Stores your files, chats, & data on their servers. DOES NOT STORE. Your data is on your device. Access to Data Can access & analyze your data and messages. CAN NOT ACCESS. Your messages are encrypted before we even receive them. Privacy Model Policy-Based (You trust them to keep their promises). Architecture-Based (Your privacy is guaranteed by the system's design). Points of Attack Centralized servers are prime targets for mass data breaches. Highly decentralized. There is no single central point to steal from. User Control You are a user within their platform. You are the sovereign owner of your own data.

docs.title: Welcome to the Future of Digital Trust
docs.text:
PinPod.io is more than just a marketplace. It's a statement—a testament that a better, fairer, and more private internet is possible. It's an ecosystem designed from the ground up to empower you, not exploit your data.

Join us in the security revolution. Experience the freedom to interact and transact with total confidence.

docs.title: PinPod.io: An Ecosystem for Individual Growth and Empowerment
docs.text: Community Slogan: "Welcome, Podlings! A place where your talents gather and thrive."

docs.title: 1. Core Philosophy and Concepts
docs.text:
PinPod is an innovative platform focused on empowering individuals through the concept of "Life Seeds." Its core philosophy is "Growing Together from Seeds."

  • Vision: PinPod serves as a "fertile ground" or "greenhouse" (a supporting ecosystem) that allows users' innate potential—whether it be skills, assets, or time—to grow and thrive.
  • PinPod Basic Formula:
  • Seed (Individual Potential) + Platform (Supporting Ecosystem) = Growth (Real Results).
  • Economic Justice: The platform aims to create a self-sustaining and balanced economic ecosystem, where growth benefits both providers (Pods) and seekers (Pins), and contributes to the community as a whole.

docs.title: 2. Ecosystem Structure and Terminology
docs.text:
All users on PinPod are called Podlings. They operate in a Dual Role (Producer-Sumer) model, meaning they can easily switch between the roles of searching and providing services.

Terminology Role/Function Description Podling Community Member A friendly term for all PinPod users. Pin Buyer A user who acts as a seeker or purchaser of services/products. Pod Seller A user who manages their own "digital storefront" or store to offer services. Bean Unit of Service The smallest specific skill, product, or service sold by a Pod. Represents raw potential. Nut Optional Add-on An optional add-on or upgrade that can be purchased alongside a Bean. BoM Agent AI Assistant A contextual Artificial Intelligence assistant for guidance, analysis, and description writing assistance.

docs.title: A. Trust and Transaction Security
docs.text:
1. Escrow System: Payment funds are securely held by the system and only released to the Pod after the Pin confirms satisfaction that the job has been completed.
  2. KYC Verification: Pods that have gone through the identity verification process are identified with a Gold icon, increasing trust.
  3. Integrated Review System: Provides transparent product ratings, statistics, and review filtering options.

docs.title: B. Discovery and Engagement Capabilities
docs.text:
1. Hyperlocal with Global Reach: Google Maps API integration enables hyper-local (hyper-local) service searches, while the platform still supports global reach.
  2. AI Assistant (BoM Agent): Serves as a search guide (General mode - Green), a business analyst (Pod mode - Purple), and a description writer/pricer (Bean Creation mode - Blue).
  3. Review Gamification: Reviewers are encouraged to provide feedback by earning PinPoints and badges, which increases active participation and trust in the system.

docs.title: 4. Technology Architecture
docs.text:
PinPod.io uses a contemporary technology stack focused on a mobile-first experience.

  • Frontend: Developed with Flutter for a seamless and consistent interface across multiple platforms (iOS, Android, Web).
  • Backend: Uses Supabase (PostgreSQL) as the core database and Firebase (for authentication and additional functionality). Supabase acts as a single API Gateway for defense-in-depth security.
  • Integrations: Includes Google Maps API for location features and various Payment Gateways to facilitate transactions.

docs.title: A. Transaction Flow
docs.text:
1. Search: Pins search for Beans based on location, category, price, or rating.
  2. Dialogue: Pins view Pod details and engage in direct negotiation.
  3. Payment: Payment goes into Escrow to protect the transaction.
  4. Disbursement: Funds are released to the Pod after the Pin confirms completion and satisfaction with the service.
  5. Rating: Pins provide reviews and ratings, which build the Pod's reputation.

docs.title: B. Business Model
docs.text: PinPod's business model focuses on a transaction commission (5-10%) deducted from Pods. Additional revenue options include advertising and subscription models.

docs.title: 6. Core Page Structure (User Interface)
docs.text:
The PinPod system has several core pages designed to support user flow:

Home Main Goal Key Features Home.dart Visitor Dashboard Free access to core features, nearby business map, search bar, trending section. Pin.dart Service Finder Dashboard Personal dashboard, interactive map, personalized recommendations, access to Agent BoM, account management. Pod.dart Business Control Center Provider gallery dashboard, review and response tracking tools, key statistics, "Switch to Pin Mode" button. Been.dart Service Editor Functionality for creating and editing Beans, setting prices, digital portfolios, and displaying the review system. login.dart & signup.dart User Authentication Login/registration form, social login (Google, Facebook), password recovery.

docs.title: 7. Development Phase
docs.text:
PinPod development is planned in three phases:

  1. MVP Phase: Covers core functionality (transactions, escrow, Pods, Beans, Pins).
  2. Phase 2: Emphasizes community enhancements, service enhancements, and additional feature integrations.
  3. Phase 3: Covers multilingual support and international expansion.
